result.execSummary:
The defendant Dalton Thomas Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Carrying a Concealed Knife, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.231.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
1) The court assessed only the DNA surcharges in this matter, waiving all others.
2) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
3) The defendant shall pay at a rate of $25 per month to probation.
4) If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety; no use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

1) The defendant shall maintain gainful employment.
2) The defendant shall obtain his GED.
The defendant shall complete Burnett County Drug Court.  He will be eligible to discharge off of probation upon graduating from Drug Court.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: All conditions of probation on Count 2 apply to Counts 3 and 5 as well.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dalton Thomas Chapman

records.addlTxt:
11:33 AM Cases 22CF33 and 21TR869 called together.  Defendant Dalton Thomas Chapman in court.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by video for Dalton Thomas Chapman.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Repka: def pleading G to Cts 2, 3, and 5, dismiss balance, 8 months imposed and stayed w/ 2 yrs probation.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas. Def enters pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 2, 3, and 5 and orders a JOC; remaining counts and 21TR869 are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def does not make a statement to the Court.  Court takes judicial notice of Burnett County case 21CF53.  Judge reinstates defendant into Drug Court today.  Def must contact Tessa Anderson today.
Court orders:
Count 2- possession of THC (MU): 2 yrs probation, imposed/stayed 6 months jail; $200 DNA
Count 3- possession of drug paraphernalia (MU): 2 yrs probation, imposed/stayed 30 days jail; $200 DNA
Count 5- carry concealed knife (MA): 2 yrs probation, imposed/stayed 6 months jail; $200 DNA
Probation concurrent, imposed/stayed jail to be consecutive if def is revoked
Conditions of probation: 
Defendant must successfully complete Drug Court; once he has, Court will allow the def to discharge off of probation immediately.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No alcohol.  Gainful employment.  Get GED. $25 /month payments.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

1:36 PM Cases 22CF3 and 21TR869 called together.  Defendant Dalton Thomas Chapman appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by video for Dalton Thomas Chapman.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case on for Status Conference.  Court recaps key events from case RE: plea/Drug Court.  Atty Repka updates the Court: another resolution is possible, requesting trial dates and a STC/potential plea hearing.  New offer recited by atty Repka: def to reapply for Drug Court after pleading G to possession of THC and possession of paraphernalia; 8 months jail imposed/stayed and 2 yrs probation.  State to dismiss firearm count outright at time of plea.  Court requires basis for possession of meth; State provides basis.

11:41 AM Called 22CF03 for ARGN and 21TR869 for STC.  Defendant, Dalton Thomas Chapman, appeared in person with Attorney Daniel P Repka by video.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State in person.  Case 22CF3 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Attny Repka updates the court, looking for STC 45 days out.  State asks if Attny Repka got email of March 31, for 3 Misdemeanor offer. Attny Repka sees it now, will need to discuss with Def.  State recites offer, def to plead G to counts 5, 6 & 7, but statutory #s incorrect on 5 & 6, so would be correct statutes for 3 counts of A Misdemeanors.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Attny Repka requests extension to file until June 24th.  Court grants.  Attny Repka updates the court that Mr. Chapman has successfully completed program.

Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information later today.  Bond continues, ARGN and STC with Judge Mogen.  Arraignment scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.
